p:
AR wP Ae. albopictus embryos were transinfected according to techniques already used for mosquito transinfection [ 53, 57, 58]. D. melanogaster belonging to the yw
67C23 genotype [ 59] was kindly furnished by Luis Teixeira (Instituto Gulbenkian de CiÃªncia, Oeiras, Portugal) to be used as wMel Wolbachia donor. Cytoplasm was withdrawn from the posterior pole of donor eggs by borosilicate needles (Sutter Instrument; Novato, CA, USA) and then injected into the posterior of the recipient embryos using MN-151/MMO-202ND micromanipulators and an IM300 microinjector (Narishige Scientific; Tokyo, Japan).
